A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It's visually stunning\, but the plot leaves a lot to be desired. [Spoilers ahead] The Finn and Rose subplot seemed completely unnecessary and the whole story focused way too much on Kylo. And for what? They established him as pretty irredeemable in TFA\, definitely got the audience to agree with it\, and for what? TLJ seems geared to appeal to some niche group of people who weren't fully convinced that committing mass genocide pretty much cements you into the dark side. For those of us who were already pretty convinced\, much of the film's focus on him seems pointless and the ending is a big \"Well\, duh.\" One star\, but only because Mark Hamill was great in this even if I wasn't a fan of how Luke was written.
